dn31:1.3: Sigālaka only appears in this sutta. His name means “little jackal”.
dn31:1.4: Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 5.5.1 recommends offerings to Agni in the east, Indra or Soma in the south, the All-gods in the west, Mitra and Varuṇa in the north, and Bṛhaspati in the middle. The quarters themselves are divine, since one can travel them and never reach the end (Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 4.1.5).
dn31:14.24: kāhiti is 3 sg fut for karoti.
dn31:26.12: Several translators have bees gathering honey, which must be a very different kind of bee! the point of the simile is that money just tends to stick to those of good conduct.
dn31:29.4: the last is a little obscure. I think it means that, when the student has completed their studies and goes off to travel, the teacher does what they can to ensure their protection in other regions.
